3.0 + CDT 2.0RC2
To reproduce, I right click on the project and select Refresh just to make 
sure everything is in sync (this is optional). Then I edit one .c file in my 
project and save it. Then I do a Search > File and type in the name of some 
string that appears in this and other files. (Note this is the regular file 
search and not the C++ search since C++ search doesn't work for me.) When I 
hit return, I get a dialog that says "Problems encountered during text search" 
with the detail info of "Resource is out of sync with the file system" and 
listing the file I just edited. I'm positive that there is no other process 
besides Eclipse modifying these files. I do not have the Refresh workspace 
automatically option turned on.

It doesn't happen every time. For example as I was writing this it was 
happening ever time. Then I closed the editor and reopened it on the same .c 
file and it would not happen at all. There are many previous errors in the 
log. Here's the tail end of the log including one error about 10 minutes 
previous to the sync error:
